definition: to have/there is/there are/to exist/to be
coin/money/CL:筆|笔[bi3]/unit of weight, one tenth of a tael 兩|两[liang3]
to have/there is/there are/to exist/to be

sentences.english: A concubine is a mistress, traditionally of a rich and powerful man.
sentences.chinese: 妾通常是一个有钱有势男人才有的小老婆。

sentences.english: They were, by and large, a very wealthy, privileged elite .
sentences.chinese: 他们基本上是一些非常有钱有势的精英。

sentences.english: So is the sense of shared purpose required to confront wealth and power.
sentences.chinese: 对抗有钱有势者所需的共同使命感也在消失。

sentences.english: The children of the rich and powerful experience privilege from birth.
sentences.chinese: 有钱有势人家的孩子从出生起就受到特别对待。

sentences.english: The haves can always win in the competition.
sentences.chinese: 有钱有势的政党常能在竞选中获胜。

sentences.english: They had just enough money and influence to make themselves disliked in a poor community.
sentences.chinese: 他们有钱有势，招来社区里贫穷人家的憎恶。

sentences.english: These are big celebrations that bring out a lot of powerful and wealthy people.
sentences.chinese: 出席这盛大的舞会的人都是一些有钱有势的人。

definition: children of officials/word created by analogy with 富二代[fu4 er4 dai4]
to take advantage of one's position to bully people (idiom)/to kick people around
rich and powerful/rich and influential person/big shot
children of entrepreneurs who became wealthy under Deng Xiaoping's economic reforms in the 1980s/see also 窮二代|穷二代[qiong2 er4 dai4]
to oppress the people/to act tyrannically
